definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to fight desperately (at the risk of one's life)
to grapple (with the enemy)/to fight at the risk of one's life
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
Hanyu Pinyin, the romanization system used in the PRC since the 1960s

sentences.english: Wanying smoothed the fragments patiently and reordered them together. Then she attentively read the letter twice.
sentences.chinese: 宛英耐心撫平團皺的碎片，一一拼上，仔細讀了兩遍。

sentences.english: I don't know how to spell the word; why don't you look it up in the dictionary?
sentences.chinese: 我不知道這個單詞怎樣拼，你爲什麼不去查一下詞典？

sentences.english: When the young man went to college, he decided to try out for the football team as a "walk-on."
sentences.chinese: 轉眼少年進了大學，決心拼進校隊，跑龍套也歡喜。

sentences.english: We want winners here, not pikers.
sentences.chinese: 你需要拼了老命在這裏工作。

sentences.english: Why have you spelled Israel like this?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你把以色列這麼拼？

sentences.english: Finally, after working on it every night for two weeks.
sentences.chinese: 接下來兩個星期的每個晚上，他都在忙弄着拼拼圖。

sentences.english: At least in my show time, I try my best to love you.
sentences.chinese: 至少在我屬於演出的時間裏，也曾拼盡全力愛過你。

sentences.english: The kids are playing bilingual jigsaw puzzle.
Your name is hard to spell .
Black gold rivals the profits in drugs.
sentences.chinese: 這些黑金可以與毒品有一拼。

sentences.english: If he is petty and does not reward his men well, his men would not give their best.
sentences.chinese: 不獎賞士卒，士卒就不會在戰鬥中拼效力。

sentences.english: Yes. Iwoulm sorry! just how do you spell your last nherewoulse! sir?
sentences.chinese: 好的，不過對不起，老師你的姓若何拼？

sentences.english: Yuling has been doing the jigsaw puzzle since nine o'clock this morning.
sentences.chinese: 自從今天早上九點鐘，玉玲已在拼圖畫了。

sentences.english: Yes.I＇m sorry, but how do you spell your last name, sir?
sentences.chinese: 好的，不過對不起，先生你的姓怎麼拼？

sentences.english: Millions of pianists in China were vying for fame.
sentences.chinese: 中國有成千上萬的鋼琴家爲出人頭第而拼掙。

sentences.english: Would you kindly spell it for me?

definition: to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
(coll.) to take a taxi/to go by taxi
to fight over/to rush/to scramble/to grab/to rob/to snatch
to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)
to put one's all into the fight
stick/club/cudgel/smart/capable/strong/wonderful/classifier for legs of a relay race
to predominate/to occupy a dominant position
